events.name: The First Chicago Google Cloud Platform User Group Meetup

group.name: Google Developers Group: GDG Cloud Chicago

events.description:
Please join us for networking and sharing tips/ideas on GCP.  We will have a networking cocktail hour at 5:30 then dive into GCP at 6:30.  

5:30 - 6:30 Networking and socialize

6:30 - 6:45 Intro to the Google Cloud meetup and objectives

6:45 - 7:15 Google Cloud demo 

7:15 - 7:30 Q/A 

We are looking for your ideas and want to make this group collaborative.  With the first Meetup, we'll showcase the power of GCP for enterprise solutions.  We will give a short demo on how to easily and quickly connect your enterprise applications into a single source of truth using the available Google Cloud products.
events.how_to_find_us: Fulton Market at the Google Chicago Office

events.name: No GCPUG This Month - Join GDG for Next Extended

venue.address_1: 222 West Merchandise Mart Plaza, Chicago, IL

group.name: Google Developers Group: GDG Cloud Chicago

events.description:
With Google Next happening in San Francisco, the team has been engulfed with activity.

Therefore, we will NOT be having a UG meeting this month.  However, you are encouraged to join The Google Developers Group for their GCP Next Extended event.  We will all be there as well.

https://www.meetup.com/Google-Developers-Group-GDG-Chicago/events/237001747/

The event is at 1871 on Wednesday March 15th at 6PM.

events.name: GCPUG - Introducing Cloud Spanner

group.name: Google Developers Group: GDG Cloud Chicago

events.description:
Notice the time change. We're trying something a little different this time. We're going with a "Breakfast with the Googles" approach. We figure, this way, you can come out, rock some GCP and a bagel, then get to work in time to have an ultra productive day :) 

Google Engineer Tim Kresler is presenting this exciting new technology.

8:30 - 9:00 AM Breakfast and Networking

9:00 - 9:45 AM Discussion and Demo - Introducing Spanner, No-Compromise Relational Database Service

9:45 - 10:30 AM Q&A, Additional Networking Opportunities

Cloud Spanner is the first and only relational database service that is both strongly consistent and horizontally scalable. With Cloud Spanner you enjoy all the traditional benefits of a relational database: ACID transactions, relational schemas (and schema changes without downtime), SQL queries, high performance, and high availability. But unlike any other relational database service, Cloud Spanner scales horizontally, to hundreds or thousands of servers, so it can handle the highest of transactional workloads. With automatic scaling, synchronous data replication, and node redundancy, Cloud Spanner delivers up to[masked]% (five 9s) of availability for your mission critical applications. In fact, Google’s internal Spanner service has been handling millions of queries per second from many Google services for years.
events.how_to_find_us: Fulton Market at the Google Chicago Office

events.name: GCPUG - Using BigQuery and Looker for Business Intelligence

group.name: Google Developers Group: GDG Cloud Chicago

events.description:
BigQuery is a petabyte-scale analytics data warehouse that you can use to run SQL queries over vast amounts of data in near real time.

Looker helps you make sense of your BigQuery data and help you analyze the data interactively. Learn how to identify trends, respond to them, and make predictions using your data in BigQuery and visualized through Looker.

5:30 - 6:30 Food, Drinks and Networking

6:30 - 6:45 Intro to Looker & BigQuery

6:45 - 7:30 Looker on BigQuery demo

7:30 - 7:45 Q & A

7:45 - 8:30 Wrap Up and Additional Networking

events.name: Sponsor Event: Cloudbakers GCP Show & Tell

group.name: Google Developers Group: GDG Cloud Chicago

events.description:
Join Cloudbakers (Proud GCPUG Sponsor!) for this event by registering on their site: http://marketing.cloudbakers.com/google-cloud-experience

-Join us for this year's Google Cloud Platform Show & Tell, where we promise to do more showing than telling. After all, we want you to experience these tools for yourself and discover ways in which we can make your organization better – more efficient processes, fewer costs, and tighter security. This event is geared towards executives and no previous technical knowledge is necessary.

Agenda:
9:00am - 9:30am | Registration & Breakfast
9:30am - 9:55am | Overview of Google Cloud Platform
9:55am - 10:30am | Diving into the Sandbox(es)
10:30am - 11:30am | Tailor the last part of the event to you! Choose to dive in to one of the following business scenarios:
1. Board Meeting
2. Workload Shift
3. Dashboard Development
4. Sentiment Analysis / Customer Satisfaction & Experience
5. Virtual Data Room

events.name: Google Event -Invite Only Special Event Must Register at https://goo.gl/d2RAFc

group.name: Google Developers Group: GDG Cloud Chicago

events.description:
THIS IS AN INVITE ONLY EVENT THAT WE ARE OPENING UP TO THE FIRST 50 REGISTRANTS. MUST REFISTER AT https://goo.gl/d2RAFc

Mainstream Machine Learning, From Hype to How-To
As machine learning becomes mainstream, organizations have infinite opportunities to gain significant advantage, but where do you start? Join us live as this webinar discusses the value of machine learning in the cloud, examples of how companies are implementing it now and practical demonstrations to guide you on your own journey today.

events.name: Serverless Data Analytics Pipeline - Google Cloud Platform

group.name: Google Developers Group: GDG Cloud Chicago

events.description:
Historically, collecting large amounts of data for both real time and batch analysis was a real pain. It required complex IT infrastructure which would create problems around scaling, reliability, performance and monitoring. Furthermore, the herculean task of maintaining this infrastructure pulls you away from the more important task of working on your business projects or creating value for your company and customers.

In this presentation, Rob Schmit - Sales Engineer with Google Cloud Platform – will show you how to quickly and seamlessly build this pipeline with serverless architecture based on the highly available, highly scalable Google Cloud Platform. Join us at 5:30 PM for a networking hour with the Aptitive team, the Google team, and your fellow GCP enthusiasts. The presentation will start at 6:30 followed by additional networking.

5:30 PM – Arrival, Registration and Networking Hour

6:30 PM – Serverless Data Analytics Pipeline

7:30 PM – Additional Networking/Provide Future Meeting Topics

group.name: Google Developers Group: GDG Cloud Chicago
